regularly send our members, plus other items which will give you more in¬
formation about the Association, Of course, Associate and Affiliate mem¬
bers do not receive as many of these materials as regularly as Active mem¬
bers do.
In addition. Active members with radio stations may use the facilities of
the NAEB Radio Network upon payment of an annual fee. The Network distri¬
butes approximately eight hours of programming, by tape recording, weekly,
to members subscribing to its service. This fee is also based on power
(with the same power classifications as membership) and a new station does
not have to pay the full fee until the third year it is in the Network.
The fees are*
Class A
Class B
Class C
1st-year
$400.00
250.00
150.00
$600.00
375.00
225.00
IrA jga:
$800.00
500.00
300.00
Stations must also pay postage both ways on the tapes shipped to and from
Network Headquarters here in Urbana, Illinois. Still even a Class A sta¬
tion paying its full third-year rate is paying only a little over $2.00
an hour for better than 400 hours of programming from the Network in a year.
This is about the most inexpensive programming a station can do.
If, after looking over the materials which we shall send you, you have fur¬
ther questions, we shall be most happy to answer them.
Sincerely,
Harold E. Hill
Associate Director
